description: From Middle English douce, from Old French dolz, dous, Middle French doux, douce, from Latin dulcis (“sweet”).

adjectives.description: douce (comparative more douce, superlative most douce)

entries.meaning: (dialect) Serious and quiet; steady, not flighty or casual; sober.
examples: what would you say of a man with plenty of silver that bided all by his lone and made his own bed and did his own baking when he might have had a wife to make him douce and brave?
